item.title: A viewer's guide to Clinton Fever
item.description: The official Clinton line has done nothing to quiet the national argument of whether she'll run.
item.author: Maggie Haberman

item.title: Nelson backs gay marriage
item.description: The senator, one of the last Democratic hold-outs against gay marriage, reverses position.
item.author: Katie Glueck

item.title: Self-loathing Republicans
item.description: POLITICO rounds up members of the GOP offering a harsh critique of the GOP.
item.author: Alexander Trowbridge

item.title: Don Imus knocks Hannity, Smith
item.description: He calls Hannity's attacks on Obama "idiotic" and and notes Smith sometimes acts "liberal."
item.author: DYLAN BYERS

item.title: Rick Perry explains border comments
item.description: He says that it's too early to assign blame for the murder of a district attorney in his state.
item.author: Katie Glueck

item.title: Obama calls Harris 'best looking' AG
item.description: President Obama, speaking at his last California fundraiser Thursday, apparently couldn't help but gush about California Attorney General Kamala Harris. And it wasn't all about her legal chops, according to a pool report, which said the president noted a couple of times that she is easy on the eyes. "She's brilliant and she's dedicated, she's tough," Obama said. "She also happens to be, by far, the best looking attorney general.... It's true! C'mon."
item.author: DONOVAN SLACK

item.title: Cabinet members to return pay
item.description: Move shows support for employees facing pay cuts.
item.author: JENNIFER EPSTEIN

item.title: Roger Ebert on politics
item.description: The late legendary film critic often offered his opinions and criticisms.
item.author: Breanna Edwards

item.title: Obama: 'Movies won't be the same'
item.description: The president mourns the passing of the legendary film critic.
item.author: JENNIFER EPSTEIN

item.title: LaPierre rips new Conn. gun laws
item.description: Says criminals and drug dealers won't "cooperate."
item.author: Breanna Edwards

item.title: Would Reagan back gay marriage?
item.description: His youngest daughter cites his friendship with gay people dating back to his years in Hollywood.
item.author: Kevin Robillard

item.title: Hill anger as LegiStorm gets personal
item.description: The congressional database's latest tool publicizes staffers' verified social media accounts.
item.author: Katie Glueck

item.title: Gingrich: Bring GOP to black districts
item.description: He's working with Univision and the chairwoman of the Congressional Black Caucus on the project.
item.author: Jake Sherman

item.title: Obama: I need Pelosi as speaker
item.description: It would be "a whole lot easier to govern," the president says at a DCCC fundraiser.

item.title: O'Reilly defends Bible remarks
item.description: The Fox News host says same-sex marriage policy cannot be influenced by "sin" analysis.

item.title: The $32,400 brunch
item.description: The president kicks off his DNC fundraising in California at an investment guru's home.

item.title: Richardson: 'Suicidal' for N. Korea to attack
item.description: He says the Obama administration needs to have an "end game."
item.author: Kevin Cirilli

item.title: W.H. spox likens GOP to Syracuse
item.description: Josh Earnest says the basketball team, similar to Republicans, "trapped" opponents in corners.
item.author: DONOVAN SLACK

item.title: 10 facts about Kim Jong Un
item.description: He's a fan of Eric Clapton and Keanu Reeves.
item.author: Kevin Cirilli

item.title: Holder: I'm still Obama's wingman
item.description: The attorney general is still coy about how long he plans to remain in the administration.

item.title: Rand Paul headed to New Hampshire
item.description: The Kentucky senator will keynote the state GOP's Liberty Dinner next month.

item.title: Adelson testifies in casino case
item.description: The GOP mega-donor defends his company before a jury in a breach of contract case.
item.author: Tarini Parti,Tal Kopan

item.title: Poll: Border security a top priority
item.description: Would be most popular part of any immigration deal.
item.author: Kevin Robillard

item.title: Pew poll first: Most say legalize pot
item.description: A majority of Americans support legalizing marijuana for the first time in 40 years, a poll says.
item.author: Kevin Robillard

item.title: Obama inspired by '42'
item.description: "I usually don't plug movies," he says, "but I strongly recommend people take their kids" to see it.
item.author: DONOVAN SLACK

item.title: Colbert Busch rival endorses Sanford
item.description: Ben Frasier got 4 percent of the vote in the primary.
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: The great gun control fizzle
item.description: Opinion: Rarely has the political class whipped itself into a lather that has abated so quickly.
item.author: Rich Lowry

item.title: Hagel calls for Pentagon shake-up
item.description: The defense secretary says the department has to adapt to tighter budgets and a changing world.
item.author: Stephanie Gaskell

item.title: Report: Federal workers losing faith
item.description: The employees had less confidence in their leaders in 2012 than the year before, the report says.
item.author: Kevin Robillard

item.title: Letterman, Maddow talk gay marriage
item.description: The debate "is absolute stupidity," says Letterman. "Humans have the right to do what humans do."

item.title: Washington: Clinton a 'Scandal' fan
item.description: The former president watches "Scandal," according to the show's star Kerry Washington.

item.title: Obama expects to win back House
item.description: "We can't have perpetual impasse" in Washington, he tells donors at a San Francisco fundraiser.

item.title: More renewables for states
item.description: Opinion: It makes economic sense to support policies that save money and create good jobs.

item.title: How Meghan McCain landed a show
item.description: She strikes hot with the kind of young viewers advertisers covet, FishbowlNY says.

item.title: Kid President in the Oval Office
item.description: In this clip, produced with footage provided by the White House, he and President Obama meet and have a chat in the Oval Office about the rigors of being president.

item.title: Rove-linked aides launch super PAC
item.description: A former Rove deputy and McConnell aide forms a super PAC that could help the Kentucky Republican.

item.title: Hunters chart middle ground on guns
item.description: Opinion: On the issue of background checks, we are able to find common ground.

item.description: The actor is speaking out against the practice of "dehorning" calves.

item.description: The son of Rep. Matt Salmon says his father's opposition to gay marriage was not a surprise.

item.title: Ari Melber joins MSNBC's 'The Cycle'
item.description: Melber has been named co-host, taking the spot left open on the show by Steve Kornacki.

item.title: Carville goes to bat for Clinton PAC
item.description: He lends his name to Ready for Hillary PAC.

item.description: The Colorado governor says the armed-guards plan for schools is the start of a slippery slope.

item.description: An influx of cash from the industry could create a political minefield for lawmakers.

item.description: The pair of Obama advisers are inducted by the American Association of Political Consultants.

item.title: GLAAD to honor Bill Clinton
item.description: The LGBT community is recognizing the former president for changing his stance on DOMA.
